snippet: Harvard’s president said the gift by the Morningside Foundation would give the school a stable financial base and the ability to give students more financial aid while expanding programs in several fields.
abstract: Morningside Foundation, group led by wealthy Hong Kong brothers Ronnie and Gerald Chan, will give $350 million to Harvard University's School of Public Health; gift is largest in university's history.
lead_paragraph: Harvard’s president said the gift by the Morningside Foundation would give the school a stable financial base and the ability to give students more financial aid while expanding programs in several fields.

headline.main: Hong Kong Group to Give Harvard’s School of Public Health $350 Million
